paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on the TTR gene variants, including penetrance data and individual records.

patients.phenotype: hereditary amyloidosis, including familiar polyneuropathy and senile cardiomyopathy

individual_records.evidence_sentence: Patient P1 developed symptoms of familial amyloidosis at age 45.
Patient P2 was diagnosed with senile cardiomyopathy at age 58.
Patient P3 is unaffected and shows no symptoms.

functional_data.summary: The TTR variant p.L55P was shown to destabilize the protein structure, leading to increased aggregation.

variants.segregation_data: The variant segregates with disease in families.
variants.additional_notes: The study highlights the role of TTR mutations in hereditary amyloidosis.
key_quotes: Transthyretin (TTR) is a homo-tetrameric protein in human blood plasma whose pathogenic mutations lead to hereditary amyloidosis.
The presence of aggregated APOA4 protein can slightly stabilize TTR mutant and inhibit its aggregation.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data was extracted from the main text.
